WaistLVBBSideBend.name: Lever Barbell Side Bend (plate loaded)
WaistLVBBSideBend.preparation: Stand with side to bar midthigh height. Grasp bar and disengage.
WaistLVBBSideBend.execution: Bend waist to opposite side of bar. Lower weight by bending toward side with bar and repeat. Continue with opposite side facing opposite direction.

WaistLVSeatedTwistingLegRaiseCrunch.name: Lever Seated Twisting Leg Raise Crunch (plate loaded)
WaistLVSeatedTwistingLegRaiseCrunch.preparation: Sit on machine with position back against back support and lower legs under padded bar. Grasp handles above to each side.
WaistLVSeatedTwistingLegRaiseCrunch.execution: Pull handles down while pulling lower leg bar up and over to one side by flexing and twisting waist and pelvis. Return and repeat movement to opposite side. Continue alternating between sides.
WaistLVSeatedTwistingLegRaiseCrunch.comments: Seat can also be locked straight or to one side. See Spot Reduction Myth.
WaistLVSeatedTwistingLegRaiseCrunch.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, tricepsbrachii, tensorfasciaelatae, pectoralissternal, sartorius, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, pectineus, quadriceps

WaistLVSeatedSideLegRaiseCrunch.name: Lever Seated Side Leg Raise Crunch (plate loaded)
WaistLVSeatedSideLegRaiseCrunch.preparation: Sit on machine with seat turned to one side. Position back against back support and lower legs under padded bar. Grasp handles above to each side.
WaistLVSeatedSideLegRaiseCrunch.execution: Pull handles down while pulling lower leg bar up by flexing waist and pelvis. Return and repeat. Turn seat to opposite side and repeat.
WaistLVSeatedSideLegRaiseCrunch.comments: Weight plates added to upper segment adds resistance, whereas, weight plates added to lower segment decreases resistance. Seat can also be oriented straight. See Spot Reduction Myth.
WaistLVSeatedSideLegRaiseCrunch.stabilizers: latissimusdorsi, tricepsbrachii, tensorfasciaelatae, pectoralissternal, sartorius, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, pectineus, quadriceps
